title: A Deeper Understanding of CSS
description: I was a presenter at the first annual Indy.Code() conference. I gave a breakout session, 1 hour talk, on CSS. The talk covered how selector specificity is calculated and how the browser knows which style to apply from the cascade. It also covered browser default styles, user agent styles, and the purpose of CSS resets/normalizers and the difference between them. Then wrapped up with implementing all of the above topics using the Inverted Triangle CSS Methodology (ITCSS).

title: Finishing the Projects you Start
description: This talk covers effective learning, defining scope, phases of a project, the differences between academic, résumé, & passion projects and how to convert them from one to another.

title: Making your first Desktop App
description: A beginner friendly, 2 hour workshop on creating a cross-platform desktop app and packaging it for distribution. This workshop was one of the highest requested topics for Free Code Camp Indy. It introduces the command line, Node, NPM, NW.js, and Vue.js. The instructions were designed to work the same for any OS (Win/Lin/OSX).

title: Web Dev Tooling
description: Gwen Faraday and I run the local Free Code Camp group. Development tooling was a highly requested topic. So we teamed up to give a presentation. I covered JavaScript, Node, NPM, Bower, Grunt, and Gulp. She covered Browserify, Rollup, and Webpack.

title: Making a desktop app, in under an hour
description: This was a talk I gave for the largest JavaScript meetup group in Indianapolis, Indy.js. It was a live coding presentation in which I walked the group though a basic "Hello World" example, followed by taking questions while building a real world example based on UGUI: WiFi (a project previously created in under an hour).

title: Upgrading your CSS
description: A precursor to "A Deeper Understanding of CSS" talk, this time given to the local Free Code Camp Indy group. It covers all the same topics as mentioned above. Some quotes from those that came to this talk can be seen below.

title: NW.js & Universal GUI
description: Talk at Indy.js meetup. This talk introduced NW.js, explained the technology behind it, and then showed some of the features of the UGUI framework.

title: Cross-Platform: NW.js
description: A lightning talk at Indy Software Artisans. The topic for the night was "Cross-Platform". I gave a short introduction to NW.js and took questions around best practices and limitations of the technology.

title: Desktop Apps made with Node
description: A 15 minute lightning talk at Node.js Indy. In this talk I walked the audience through creating a "Hello World" desktop app followed by exploring some of the NW.js API and answering questions.

title: A Deeper Understanding of CSS
description: I was approached by a Computer Science student from IUPUI at a Free Code Camp Indy meetup. I had recently given a conference talk on CSS and he thought his fellow students would be interested in it. The talk was given to the IUPUI Computer Club, and was followed by a Q & A.

title: Comprehensive Pen Tool Tutorial
description: This is an intro to the basics of Illustrator and everything there is to know about the Pen tool. Though for Illustrator, much of it is transferrable to Photoshop and other Adobe software that has the pen tool built in as well. It covers all 4 iterations of the Pen Tool, the Select Tool (black arrow), and the Direct Select Tool (white arrow). It also covers every usage of these 6 tools on Anchor Points, Handles, and Segments, along with every modifier key (Ctrl, Alt, and Shift). This video has made YouTube history by having no negative comments; something previously theorized to be possible, but had never been successfully proven.

title: Finishing the Projects you Start
description: This is the most requested talk by the members of the Free Code Camp Indy meetup group. It covers effective learning, defining scope, phases of a project, the differences between academic, résumé, & passion projects and how to convert them from one to another.

title: Finishing the Projects you Start
description: I was requested to give a talk at IUPUI as part of SIGGRAPH. It was requested that my talk be applicable to anyone, and not just programmers. This talk covers effective learning, defining scope, phases of a project, the differences between academic, résumé, & passion projects and how to convert them from one to another.

title: Vue-Router: Everything you could possibly know about it
description: A complete introduction to the concepts behind routing from a server and client side perspecitve. This talk covers all major features of the Vue-Router plugin.

title: Vue.js is so freaking awesome (An Introduction)
description: A beginner level intro to Vue.js, current usage statistics, it's history, the surrounding ecosystem, and how to use it. We mainly focus on the basics of using it via a CDN, but also touch on Single File Components and Vue-CLI. We walk through the templates and directives, methods, computed, and created.

title: Crafting the Perfect Developer Résumé
description: This talk covers how to break down your resume into sections for the 3 types of people that will be looking at it (HR/Recruiter, Dev/Team Manager, Senior/Team Lead). How much attention should be placed on each section of the resume, what things to highlight, and more importantly what things to avoid.
